alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 01 at 5:30PM PDT until September 01 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE PILOT AND 3-9 BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Pilot and 3-9 burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Northern Humboldt Interior and Southern Humboldt Interior. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Pilot and 3-9 burn scar thunderstorms with heavy rainfall in are expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Pilot and 3-9 burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Pilot and 3-9 fire burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. Rain rates may exceed 0.5 inches in one hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior
